title: Looking for typefaces with a single storey a
content:
I know this isn't quite an ID subject but i'm looking for typefaces with a single storey a. Avant Garde and Futura are the only ones that come to mind off the top of my head so I could do with some real help!

Thanks
author: clare.holmes

comments.content:
Stone Informal: [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-stone-informal/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150221091157/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-stone-informal/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-stone-informal/")

FontFont:  
QType, SuperGrotesk, Jackie, Maverick, Fontsoup, Advert, ...

and many many more

If you want to advance make sure your terminology is correct  
because you can find many italics with the 'a' you are looking for, e.g.:  
 [http://www.bertholdtypes.com/adobe\_lib/080218000.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150221091157/http:/www.bertholdtypes.com/adobe_lib/080218000.html "http://www.bertholdtypes.com/adobe\_lib/080218000.html")

Regards,  
AS

So what's the story with "a" anyway?

ChrisL

There are many. First to my head:  
 [Century Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150221091157/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=M.10372.0.0)  
 [FF Super Grotesk](http://web.archive.org/web/20150221091157/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=FF.11133.0.0)  
 [Drescher Grotesk](http://web.archive.org/web/20150221091157/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=drescher)  
 [Plantin Schoolbook](http://web.archive.org/web/20150221091157/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=M.9230.0.0)  
 [Proxima Nova](http://web.archive.org/web/20150221091157/http:/ms-studio.com/FontSales/proximanova.html) has an alt 'a'. (see "all characters")

Prixima looks good with it too.

ChrisL

Fresco Sans Informal from OurType  
 [http://www.ourtype.be](http://web.archive.org/web/20150221091157/http:/www.ourtype.be/ "http://www.ourtype.be")

Bembo Schoolbook, another rare serif with a one-story "a":  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/bembo-mt/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150221091157/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/bembo-mt/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/bembo-mt/")

Some older slab serifs have the "a" you're looking for, including Lubalin Graph and Memphis.
With so many results... the word lazyness comes to mind :)
